demo: In demo mode the survey can't be saved

login.message: Please enter your phone number and the access token which we sent you.
login.error: We couldn't find the survey. Please check again the phone number and access token. Please contact the Social Income team if the error persists.

common.missingCredentials: Missing credentials for the survey. Please contact the Social Income team.
common.authError: Error during login. Please contact the Social Income team.
common.loadingError: Error loading the survey. Please contact the Social Income team.
common.progressSavingError: Your answer couldn't be saved. Retrying... Please contact the Social Income team if the error persists.
common.completed: Thank you very much for completing the survey.
common.alreadyCompleted: This survey is already completed. Thank you very much.
common.welcome: The goal of this survey is to find out the impact of a Social Income for you. Takes around 5 minutes to complete.

questions.hasDependentsDescV1: People who depend financially on you.
questions.nrDependentsTitleV1: How many people depend on you financially?
questions.employmentStatusTitleV1: What is your current employment status?
questions.notEmployedTitleV1: Are you currently looking for work?
questions.disabilityTitleV1: Do you have a disability or illness that affects your possibilities of getting work or keeping your job?
questions.skippingMealsTitleV1: Do you or other family members in your household ever skip meals because there wasn't enough money for food?
questions.skippingMealsLastWeek3MealsTitleV1: Did you skip more than 3 meals in the past week?
questions.unexpectedExpensesCoveredTitleV1: Do you have enough money to cover unexpected expenses like seeing a doctor?
questions.unexpectedExpensesCoveredDescV1: A doctor costing for example 100 SLE or above.
questions.savingsTitleV1: Are you currently able to save money?
questions.debtPersonalRepayTitleV1: Are you able to repay the debt?
questions.debtHouseholdTitleV1: Is anyone in your household in debt?
questions.debtHouseholdWhoRepaysTitleV1: Are you the main person repaying the debt?
questions.otherSupportTitleV1: Are you currently receiving any other form of financial support from anywhere else?
questions.plannedAchievementTitleV1: What do you hope to achieve within the next 3 years with Social Income?
questions.spendingTitleV1: What are the key categories that you spend your Social Income payments on?
questions.spendingDescV1: Education: school fees, stationary, textbooks etc. // Food for you or your household // Housing: rent, house maintenance etc. // Health care: doctor, hospital visit, medicine etc. // Transportation: bus, taxi, poda poda, keke etc. // Saving: on bank account or mobile money account etc. // Investment: fertilizers, tools, diesel for machinery etc.
questions.spendingRankingTitleV1: Please rank the selected spending categories from the most important to the least.
questions.spendingRankingDescV1: You can drag and drop the categories.
questions.plannedAchievementRemainingTitleV1: What do you hope to achieve within the remaining time in the Social Income program?
questions.financialIndependenceTitleV1: Did Social Income make you feel financially more secure and independent?
questions.impactLifeGeneralTitleV1: What impact did Social Income have on your life?
questions.longEnoughTitleV1: Was three years of Social Income payments long enough to become financially stable?
questions.achievementsAchievedTitleV1: Have you achieved what you hoped to over the course of the last three years?
questions.achievementsNotAchievedCommentTitleV1: What has kept you from achieving this goal? Is there something we could have done to further support you? (e.g. mentoring, connections)
questions.happierTitleV1: Has Social Income made you feel happier?
